column1: '''''The Lord of the Rings: The White Council''''' was a role-playing video game under development at [[Electronic Arts]] Los Angeles.  It was to be based on [[J.R.R. Tolkien]]'s [[The Lord of the Rings|book]] and [[The Lord of the Rings (film series)|''The Lord of the Rings'' (film series)]]
column4: EA announced that the game had been put on an indefinite hiatus
column5: and to date no further information has been released.

column1: Initial details were limited about the game
column2: but the official site contained art
column3: pictures of the team working on this game
column6: and a designer's diary feature (which included
column8: only humorous "behind-the-scenes" videos which purported to share design details but which were "accidentally" out-of-focus or otherwise unintelligible
column9: thereby offering only a tease designed to stoke early fan interest). The website also contained a letter from the game's executive producer Steve Gray:

column1: {{quote|The action takes place in a massive open world where you can go anywhere you want
column2: and the characters in this world are powered by an incredible simulation AI based on the same technology used by the makers of ''The Sims 2''. The story of the game is built around a series of Story Quests. You can choose to follow specific Story Quests
column3: embark on a range of other types of quests
column4: or set off on your own adventures in the massive open world environment.|Steve Gray}}
